alert.note: Alert for Banner; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 21 at 4:21PM CST until December 21 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Scotts Bluff County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Northeastern Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southeastern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 320 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Stegall, or 15 miles west of Scottsbluff, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. US Highway 26 near Scottsbluff. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Morrill, Minatare, Lyman, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Lake Minatare Campground, Stegall, Wildcat Hills Campground, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Hubbard Hill, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Minatare, Melbeta and McGrew. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
